pull.title: Net: Fixed a race condition when disabling the network.
pull.body:
This change addresses a race condition where setnetworkactive=false wouldn't always disconnect all peers.

Before this change, the following could happen:
1. Thread A -- Begins connecting to a node.
2. Thread B -- Sets kNetworkActive=false and disconnects connected nodes.
3. Thread A -- Finishes connecting and adds node to list of connected nodes.

The node that was connected from Thread A remains connected and active,
even though kNetworkActive=false.

To fix the race, disconnections when kNetworkActive=false are now handled in the main network loop.

fixes #13038

events.body:
utACK 8e2e21b.

Now sockets are closed after `NotifyNetworkActiveChanged` signal is emitted but from what I've seen it doesn't matter.

@lmanners Thanks, this appears to fix the #13038 bug that I reported. Tested ACK

- I verified that the bug is still easily reproducible with current master branch commit 6738813bcbb730b5a19e67482b6612d568c22699.
- I applied this patch.
- I verified that I was not able to reproduce the bug with multiple attempts.

Tested with:

`/bitcoin/src/qt/bitcoin-qt -datadir=/data/bitcoin-unpruned-txindex -txindex -disablewallet -persistmempool=0 -printtoconsole -debug=net`

I believe this is an example of the race that I was able to capture and see being handled cleanly by this patch:

```
2018-05-21T12:20:30Z SetNetworkActive: false
2018-05-21T12:20:31Z Added connection peer=13
2018-05-21T12:20:31Z sending version (103 bytes) peer=13
2018-05-21T12:20:31Z send version message: version 70015, blocks=523490, us=[::]:0, peer=13
2018-05-21T12:20:31Z Network not active, dropping peer=13
2018-05-21T12:20:31Z disconnecting peer=13
2018-05-21T12:20:31Z Cleared nodestate for peer=13

2018-05-21T12:21:32Z SetNetworkActive: true
2018-05-21T12:21:33Z trying connection 180.107.22.115:8333 lastseen=36.9hrs
2018-05-21T12:21:33Z Added connection peer=14
2018-05-21T12:21:33Z sending version (103 bytes) peer=14
2018-05-21T12:21:33Z send version message: version 70015, blocks=523490, us=[::]:0, peer=14
2018-05-21T12:21:34Z trying connection 176.223.201.198:8333 lastseen=0.2hrs

2018-05-21T12:21:34Z SetNetworkActive: false
2018-05-21T12:21:34Z Network not active, dropping peer=14

2018-05-21T12:21:34Z Network not active, dropping peer=15
2018-05-21T12:21:34Z disconnecting peer=15
2018-05-21T12:21:34Z Cleared nodestate for peer=15
```

issue.title: faulty network activity disable
issue.body:
The network activity disable feature does not disable network activity. After clicking the tray icon to disable network activity, network connections establish and are used to transfer data as normal. I have only verified this with bitcoin-qt on Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS and Tails (multiple versions). I've witnessed this happen for clearnet and onion peers.

I have verified that this affects versions Bitcoin Core version v0.16.0 (release build) and the latest commit 8b262eb2d80bfa27ae8501078ce47bc1407e9c55 on master (IIRC, I saw this in earlier release builds too).

To reproduce:
Note: the first two steps may not be strictly necessary, but they definitely seem to help reproduce.
1. use slow storage attached via usb (e.g.- 7200 RPM drive inside a 2.5" SATA external case attached via USB 3)
1. let node fall behind (only a day at most, less likely works) and then attempt to resync
1. start node with: `$ /path/to/bitcoin-0.16.0/bin/bitcoin-qt -datadir=/path/to/bitcoin-unpruned-txindex-datadir -txindex &`
1. wait until you see some established peers on the peers tab in the GUI
1. click the icon in the tray of the main GUI window to disable network activity
1. go back to the peers tab and witness peers establish and transfer data. sometimes this happens immediately, sometimes it takes a few seconds. usually around a minute at most.

events.body:
Thanks for testing this @mruddy!

Note: when I did my own testing, I added a sleep statement in CConnman::OpenNetworkConnection just after fNetworkActive is checked, to make the race condition reproduce consistently.
Please squash your commits according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits

events.message:
Net: Fixed a race condition when disabling the network.

This change addresses a race condition where setnetworkactive=false wouldn't always disconnect all peers.

Before this change, the following could happen:
1. Thread A -- Begins connecting to a node.
2. Thread B -- Sets kNetworkActive=false and disconnects connected nodes.
3. Thread A -- Finishes connecting and adds node to list of connected nodes.

The node that was connected from Thread A remains connected and active,
even though kNetworkActive=false.

To fix the race, disconnections when kNetworkActive=false are now handled in the main network loop.

fixes #13038

events.body:
Tested ACK.
I just retested the squashed commit 793290f940a9af18d4f0292a263d976a066dff65 on top of current master 686e97a0c7358291d628213447cf33e99cde7ce8. LGTM

issue.title: commits from bitcoin/master
issue.body:
tests: fixes mininode's P2PConnection sending messages on closing transport
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13715

depends: disable Werror when building zmq
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13689

[trivial] Correct help text for `importaddress` RPC
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13074

wallet: Fix non-determinism in ParseHDKeypath(...). Avoid using an uninitialized variable in path calculation.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13712

Add createwallet "disableprivatekeys" option: a sane mode for watchonly-wallets
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9662

docs: Specify preferred Python string formatting technique
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13718

p2p: Remove dead service bits code
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11637

lint: Add linter for circular dependencies
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13695

Remove boost::program_options dependency
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13482

Fix bitcoin-cli --version
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13725

Utils and libraries: Removes the boost/algorithm/string/join dependency
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13726

wallet: Introduce assertion to document the assumption that cache and cache_used are always set in tandem
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13683

trivial: Replace CPubKey::operator[] with CPubKey::vch where possible
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13722

Remove redundant variables, statements and forward declarations
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13691

doc: Remove field in getblocktemplate help that has never been used.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12764

Avoid locking mutexes that are already held by the same thread
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11762

Utils: Refactor ArgsManager a little
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13733

Drop dead code from Stacks
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13633

Net: Fixed a race condition when disabling the network.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13212

trivial: remove unneeded include
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13740

Avoid creating a temporary vector for size-prefixed elements
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13719

tests: Skip P2PConnection's is_closing() check when not available
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13747

issue.title: Backport poll() code from Bitcoin
issue.body:
This backports bitcoin#14335 and bitcoin#14336. bitcoin#13503 is also backported to avoid a merge conflict.

Long term goal is to implement epoll() in the future, which will reduce network overhead (select/poll) to basically zero (it's ~80% right now with 400 connections).

issue.title: Remove fix for fNetworkActive vs OpenNetworkConnection race
issue.body: This is not needed anymore due to bitcoin#13212 being backported

comments.body: You can  install `clang-format` and run the https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/master/contrib/devtools#clang-format-diffpy script to preempt whitespace nitpicking.
Fixed the formatting using clang-format-diff.py. Thanks!
